etymology.description: 看(看) (kàn, "look") + 一下(一下) (yīxià, "a bit; once") = take a look briefly.
etymology.interpretation: The phrase 看一下(看一下) (kàn yīxià, "take a look") uses 看(看) (kàn, "look") to mean viewing or observing something, and 一下(一下) (yīxià, "a bit; once") to indicate doing something for a brief or short duration. Together, they form a polite and common expression to ask someone to give something a quick glance or review.

examples.chinese: 看一下那个(看一下那個)。
请看一下这本书(請看一下這本書)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng kàn yīxià zhè běn shū.
examples.english: Please take a look at this book.

examples.chinese: 我看一下(我看一下)，再决定(再決定)。
examples.english: I'll take a look, then decide.
